title: The One Doctor
author: Gareth Roberts & Clayton Hickman
filename: 027 - The One Doctor - Gareth Roberts & Clayton Hickman_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
1. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM - DAY
Up on DOCTOR WHO's voice... deep and menacing...
WHO At last, I control everything...” you are my pawns, to do with as I please... you have no choice but to bend to my will... yes, I own you... I am your creator — and I can be your destroyer...
FX - The TARDIS background in-flight hum fades up quick.
Honestly, Doctor, stop being so melodramatic.
WHO Mel, am I not permitted an occasional moment of melodrama?
Yes, but it’s only a game of Monopoly.
WHO A game that I am winning... yes, there is no power but mine... I control Park Lane, Mayfair, the waterworks...
Doctor!
WHO I want to imagine what it feels like to be a power crazed dictator. See into the enemy’s mind.
And?
WHO Boring. And I hate hotels. Your roll.
FX - Rolling dice in a tumbler.
MELANIE A double six,
WHO You're the iron, I’m the dog.
Sorry.
WHO You're getting absent-minded. Most unlike you.
(Groans) Oh no.
WHO Excellent. You must surrender to my will... two thousand, two hundred and sixty pounds rent, please.
All right.*
WHO By the way, why did you reset the coordinates this morning?
I thought you did.
WHO Yet more absent-mindedness...
I haven’t been near the controls. Guide’s honour.
WHO (Amused) You were a Girl Guide?
FX — MEL moves to the console. She punches some keys with appropriate
bleeps.
Never mind that. These readings... the TARDIS is way off course...
WHO Way, way off course... we've drifted millennia into the far future..
Who's done this? Who could control the TARDIS?
WHO The same person who always does - or tries to. Me.
What do you mean?

WHO I was experimenting with the navigation settings... and I must have accidentally switched on the wide-range distress transceiver. Knocked it with my elbow.’ The TARDIS responded automatically, like a dog fetching a bone. Yes, listen...
FX — An urgent series of high-pitched bleeps.
Where's it coming from?
WHO I don’t know. But we’re almost on top of it. (Wearily) We'd better materialise, I suppose... ?
Don’t worry, Doctor. We'll finish the game later. What's the matter?
WHO I just wish, sometimes, people could sort their problems out all by themselves. I mean, why does it always have to be me?
2. EXT. GENERIOS STREET - DAY
FX - The sound of cheering and laughing. Celebratory music. A very big

party is underway. Perhaps the sound of some hovering vehicle zooming past. This is the far future, after all. The TARDIS materialises with its customary wheezing and groaning. Nobody takes a blind bit of notice.
3. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM - DAY
So - where exactly are we?
WHO The vulgar end of time.
Eh?
WHO I prefer never to go this far.
Why?

WHO Everything’s been discovered. Everybody knows everybody else, and everybody knows everybody else’s business. All the wars are over — the interesting ones anyway. Technology’s made every pleasure affordable. Nobody strives... not that there’s anything worth striving for... it’s hedonism, hedonism, hedonism all the way... MELANIE And that’s a bad thing? How far ahead are we? After my time?
WHO Oh, 1989 is long gone. Although I suppose that's one reason for us to look on the bright side!
Hmm. I might get a straight answer from the data bank...
FX - Bleeps and general key-punching as MEL consults the data bank.

(CONT'D) According to this we’re on Generios 1°, central planet of the Great Generios System, in the constellation of... Generios. Hmm. ‘A mighty galactic trade Empire spanning seventeen planets’. And they need our help.
WHO Let’s have a look at the old scanner.
Silo scanner shutters slide open. We hear the sound of the crowd outside.
Looks like a party.
WHO Appearances can be deceptive.
Yes... perhaps they’ve been brainwashed into submission by invading aliens...
WHO (Gently chiding) Melodrama! Pass me my coat, will you?® (Shrugging it on)” Let’s divine the truth of the matter.
FX - The TARDIS doors open.
4. EXT. GENERIOS STREET - DAY
FX — More cheering of VE Day proportions. MEL emerges from the
TARDIS. te .
Don’t think much of this place. It’s kind of bland — everybody and everything the same...°
FX ~ DOCTOR WHO follows MEL out and locks the TARDIS door.
WHO I did warn you.” Wonder why they’re all so jubilant?
A drunk, but amiable Generiosian, SOKKERY, approaches.
Hey, citizen! I like the coat!
WHO Thank you... but would you mind not dribbling on to it...'"
Fancy a drop of this?
FX-A half empty bottle is sloshed about.
WHO I rarely drink.
Come on, chum!'’ Everybody's got to let go on a day like this!
He rarely lets go.
WHO What’s happened? We've only just arrived. We picked up a distress call.
Sorry... wasted journey. Here, you have a drop, pretty lady... anyone ever tell you you've got amazing ringlets?”
Never mind my ringlets. What are you celebrating?
We've been saved... the Skelloids are vanquished..."
Skelloids?
WHO Skelloids?

(With relish) Ferocious aliens from the outer reaches of deep space... like living skeletons. There were hundreds of them, vicious and deadly, ready to land their mother ship on this, our Great City of Generios. They would have enslaved us.
But you defeated them?
Oh no. We were useless. The Great Council tried to make peace with the Skelloids and failed. And our defences were totally inadequate.
WHO So - what became of these ‘Skelloids’?'’ Did they just pack up and go home for tea?
Course not - the Skelloids never give up. The Doctor sorted them out for us, didn’t he?
A big incidental music moment.
WHO The Doctor... did you say the Doctor?
Yeah... you know, the mysterious Time Lord. Travels the universe poking his nose in, putting things to rights. You must know the legends.
WHO Yes, I believe I have heard something...
FX - We faintly hear a group of people dancing the conga nearby.

I thought it was a lot of billy rot until he actually turned up and saved the day. With his assistant — phwoarr, lovely girl. Anyway, I've spent long enough talking to you two - there’s a conga over there with my name on it!
FX - SOKKERY goes off, taking the conga with him.
WHO I said they were vulgar.
It looks like you've already saved the day, then. Beaten yourself to it.
WHO Somehow I doubt it.’* I've never been to Generios before.
Then you will in the future.
WHO I doubt that too.
Why?
WHO I can sense the proximity of another self, having experienced it on several occasions.'® My hair stands on end.
(Laughing) How could it? : ; ;
WHO (Deadly serious) Figuratively speaking. And this time it hasn't.
You're really rattled, aren’t you? i
WHO Yes. Because if I didn't save this planet from the evil Skelioids - who is the Doctor that did...?
5, INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - DAY
A big, draughiy, vaulted room. The celebrating crowd can be heard - close, but muffled. Enter POTIKOL, the rather fey and nervous head councilor.
Listen to the citizens! This day is truly unique in the Great Annals of Generios! The people rejoice!
FX - We hear the crowd chanting, ‘WE WANT THE DOCTOR! WE WANT
THE DOCTOR!’
(CONT’D) They’re crying out for their saviour! Are you sure you won't step out on to the balcony, Doctor?

Ah, but this isn't really the Doctor. Here we meet BANTO ZAME and SALLY-ANNE, confidence tricksters. Both are currently doing fair, if rather over-the-top impressions of Doctor Who and his assistant. BANTO is being terribly bombastic and grandiose while SALLY-ANNE is the very model of simpering naivete. These, as we shall see, are not their natural states,
ZAME I’m sorry, Councillor Potikol, but I hate farewells.
But you've done so much for us — saved the seventeen planets from certain annihilation...
ZAME Please - any passing genius would have done the same.
(Laughs obsequiously) Tell me again — how did you defeat the Skelloids?
ZAME It was simple enough - after I worked out their entire life cycle was based on the absorption of hydrogen through their gill-plates.
Go on.
ZAME I simply inverted the core of their hydrogen stabilisers. With a little help from my psychic screwdriver ~ and a little help from Sally Anne.
SALLY-ANNE I wondered when you'd get round to mentioning me.
Generios is indebted to your assistant as well, Doctor. SALLY-ANNE So the core sucked hydrogen from the Skelloids instead of supplying it to them.

Result - skedaddle, Skelloids! They won’t be back again — well, at least, not for another couple of aeons. Anyway, Potikoi, time’s winged chariot marches on - especially for a Time Lord. Sally-Anne and I really must get back to the TARDIST (sic).'”
Must you leave us, Doctor?
ZAME I'm afraid so.
How can we ever repay you for saving us?
pea) Ae I don’t expect repayment — the work I do is reward in itself.
SALLY-ANNE (As if struck by an idea) Hey Doctor - what about the pluvon power crystals?
ZAME Eh? Oh yes...
Pluvon power crystals? SALLY-ANNE We need them for the TARDIST. And we’re running dry.
I'm afraid we have no such crystals. The seventeen
planets were mined out generations ago.
SALLY-ANNE Yes -— but you’ve got the cash we could use to buy them.
ZAME Come on, Sally-Anne, that’s out of the question. Goodbye, Councillor —
One moment, Doctor. How much do you need to buy these crystals you seek?
ZAME Really, I won't hear of it —
Doctor. SALLY-ANNE About a hundred million credits.
(Shocked) A hundred million...
ZAME Yes, quite. It’s our problem, not yours. So we'll just slip quietly away...
No. I won't hear of it. If a hundred million is what you need, Doctor, Sally-Anne - a hundred million is what you shall have.
ZAME No, Potikol, I absolutely insist — I will not take your money.
Please, Doctor. What is a hundred million credits weighed against the lives of all in the seventeen planets?
SALLY-ANNE Go on, Doctor.
ZAME I do have principles, you know...
SALLY-ANNE You won't have much use for them if we don’t get those power crystals.
ZAME You have a point... Very well, Councillor.
You will accept our gift.
ZAME As a loan. I will find some way to repay you.
Doctor, Doctor, what more could you have done for us?
I will go at once to the Great Bank of Generios and make out a cheque.”
ZAME Ev... I'd prefer cash. I don’t actually have a bank account myself. Never had much use for money.
I understand. It shall be done. Wait here.
FX - POTIKOL exits through a sliding door. Immediately he’s gone,
ZAME and SALLY-ANNE burst into laughter and revert to their real personas. SALLY-ANNE is as common as muck, while BANTO is cynical, brusque and ever-so-slightly camp.
ZAME Ha ha... there's one born every nanosecond... SALLY-ANNE Banto, this lot have gotta be the doziest load of prawns
yet.

ZAME ‘Please, Doctor. What is a hundred million credits weighed against the lives of all in the seventeen planets?’ What a plank! SALLY-ANNE ‘Time marches on ~ especially for a Time Lord’ Loved it Pass me one of them beers.
FX - Two lager cans are opened.
ZAMB To us - and to our ‘pluvon power crystals’. SALLY-ANNE (Mock appalled) Oh Doctor - you’re not going to spend that money on something else, are you?
ZAME Come here and give us a kiss.
PX - BANTO ZAME and SALLY-ANNE kiss.
ane
6. EXT. OUTSIDE COUNCIL COMPLEX - DAY ;
We're outside the council complex now — much FX cheering, clapping and good-natured hammering on the door.
WHO This must be it — their Great Council Complex. Everything around here seems to be Great.'”
Great! So how are we going to get inside? Knock on the door?
WHO Everybody’s knocking on the door.
FX - The crowd start cheering, ‘WE WANT THE DOCTOR’ again.
Somebody’s popular. (She sees SOKKERY) Oh no...”
WHO What?
It’s him again.
Hello.*! Come to see the Doctor, have you? They reckon he’s gonna step out on to the balcony up there.
WHO Is that some sort of newspaper you’ve got there?
Eh? Oh yeah, Great Visi-Mcho of Generios. Special commemorative edition.
That must be him — plastered all over the front page...
Yeah, that’s the Doctor.”
WHO Give me that...
FX - DOCTOR WHO snatches the newspaper.
Here, steady on, there’s a voucher for the Great Commemorative Tea-towel in there...
FX - DOCTOR WHO jabs a finger at the paper.
WHO Look at that Mel! It is definitely not me!
How can you be so sure?
WHO I have assumed several guises over the centuries but have always maintained an essential air of Olympian dignity. Look at this buffoon!
He looks all right to me.
WHO All right? Ali right? FPlorid complexion, nose like a mulberry... and his figure is positively rotund!
You’re not exactly sylphlike.

WHO There is a difference between being big-boned and being portly! There’s no doubt about it ~ I must confront this impostor. Impersonating a Time Lord is a serious offence. I may need this paper as evidence.
FX — DOCTOR WHO stuffs the paper into his pocket.
Hey!
How are we going to get in?
(Sulky now) You can’t. Without a pass.”
WHO I can go anywhere I like. (Cunning, slow) Mel... how’s your wilting willow impersonation?
Big, end-of scene twinkling music. A beat.**
What? What are you talking about?
WHO I mean - I’ve got a plan.
Why didn’t you just say so?
WHO Ev... yes. Sorry.
7. INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - DAY.
We're back with BANTO ZAME and SALLY-ANNE, still smooching.
SALLY-ANNE ’Ere, get off, Banto. Someone might come through that door any second. Won’t suit our image to be all crumpled and rumpled.
ZAME I wonder where he is with that cash? It’s been twenty minutes.
SALLY-ANNE What, you don't reckon he might’ve rumbled us?”
ZAME Fotikol? He’s a fool. Remember when the ‘Skelloid Commander’ told him to (alien voice) ‘surrender or die’?
SALLY-ANNE Yeah, hur hur... 1 thought he were gonna have an accident.
FX — POTIKOL's footsteps.
ZAME That’s him - get up. Quick sticks! And hide those cans!
FX - They straighten themselves out. The beer cans are flung into a
corner as the door opens and POTIKOL enters. BANTO and SALLY-ANNE revert to their Doctor Who personas.
Doctor, Doctor...
SALLY-ANNE Oh Councilor, did you manage to get the money?
ZAME I still feel extremely dubious about this arrangement, Sally-Anne.
SALLY-ANNE Ignore him, Councillor — too proud, that’s his trouble.
I'm afraid there’s been a slight problem. SALLY-ANNE You what? I mean - a problem, you say? POTIKOL The computer links to the Great Bank of Generios are
being... influenced somehow.
ZAME Influenced?
‘Yes. In fact, all the workings of the Great Computers of Generios are slipping somewhat out of our control.
SALLY-ANNE What - your cash machine’s on the blink?”
If only it were that simple.
ZAME Potikol, please get to the point. POTIKOL At first we thought the interference was perhaps an after-
effect of the Skelloids’ handiwork.
ZAME I doubt it. ] mean - unlikely.
But our Great Radarscopes have just reported a foreign object — a piece of space debris - that has drifted into the System.
ZAME And it’s interfering with your computers somehow?
We think so. But do not fret, Doctor. I have dispatched a space dredger to blast it out of the skies.” All will be well. Excuse me while I attend to the arrangements...
FX — POTIKOL exits. The door closes. BANTO and SALLY-ANNE revert to
type.
SALLY-ANNE {I told you. They’ve cottoned on. We ought to get out of here.
ZAME And lose our chance of a hundred million credits? SALLY-ANNE You don’t believe all his fluff about flotsam?
ZAME Why ever not? There are still huge chunks of debris floating round from the Skardu/Rosbrix wars.
SALLY-ANNE Floating out this far?
ZAME Just relax, my little coelacanth. Here have another can. Listen, if they had the slightest doubt about us, we’d be clapped in irons by now.
FX - Can opens.
SALLY-ANNE (Taking a sip) Ooh... doesn’t sound too uncomfortable, if I was with you.
ZAME And I with you, my turtle dove.
SALLY-ANNE Ooh, be romantic.
ZAME Later. When I’ve got that hundred million in my hand I'll be very romantic.
8. INT. COUNCIL COMPLEX CORRIDORS- DAY
inside the Council Complex. FX doors open. We hear the crowd.
This way, sir...
FX — The shuffling of feet as the GUARD and DOCTOR WHO carry
inside. She groans, feebly.
WHO I'm sorry, she’s usually a very picture of health.
FX — Doors close. The crowd are cut out.
(Woozy) Oh... where am I? I feel...
WHO Now now, Mel, you've just fainted in the crush, that’s all.
Just lay her down here, sir, against the wall.”
WHO There you go.
It must have been the excitement of being that close to the Doctor...
WHO (Arch) Indeed.
I could do with a glass of water — clear my head.”
WHO If it’s not too much trouble. We'll just wait here. Innocently.
Right you are, sir. 1 won't be a second — there’s a cooler round the corner.
FX - The GUARD moves off.
WHO Right. Let’s slip off.
Which way? These corridors all look the same.
WHO Not to a corridor veteran like me. This way — I’m rather excited about meeting the Doctor myself.
FX - They move off, stealthily.
9. INT. ANOTHER CORRIDOR - DAY
The GUARD is filling a glass of water from the cooler and humming softly to himself. FX - water pouring into cup. We hear POTIKOL approaching in a great flurry from a distance.
Guard! Guard! Summon the council!
Councillor! Whatever's the matter?
POTIKOL A great calamity - another great calamity — has befallen us! Inform the council that our dredger has been destroyed.”
Not the Skelloids?
No, not the Skelloids. Well don’t just stand there man, get
off and summon the council. And give me that glass of water.
FX — He snatches the glass and gulps it down.
Yes sir. On my way sir. The GUARD hurries off.
Oh, what a day... what a day...
10. INT. OUTSIDE COUNCIL CHAMBER - DAY
WHO and MELANIE have arrived outside the chamber. They are whispering.
WHO This must be the place.
How can you be sure?
WHO That sign on the door - ‘Great Council Chamber of Generios’.
Well you were standing in front of it!
WHO I imagine this is where we’ll find their guest of honour.
11, INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - DAY
ZAME and SALLY-ANNE are now rather merry.
ZAME ...we could buy ourselves a nice slab of real estate out on the rim worlds...
SALLY-ANNE The rim worlds?
ZAME Yes, what about buying up Abidos?
SALLY-ANNE Abidos? There’s nowt there.’
ZAME There will be. We’ll build a pleasure complex... SALLY-ANNE Ooohh...
ZAME To satisfy our every desire... We'll be outside the law. No amusement too extreme... no diversion too decadent...
SALLY-ANNE We could have bingo and ice-rinks.
ZAME I was thinking more of a total sensory immersion device, like they have on Zynglat 3.
SALLY-ANNE Oooh... I like the sound of total sensory emulsion...
ZAME Immersion...
FX - The door bursts open as DOCTOR WHO and MEL enter.
ZAME (CONT’D) What the...? Here —- who are you?
WHO I think it is who should be directing that question to you.
ZAME I, sir, am the Doctor.
WHO The Doctor, eh?
You're not the Doctor, this is the Doctor!
SALLY-ANNE ’Ere, what’s going on?
ZAME Oh, [ understand. Yes, it’s all becoming very clear. You are the Doctor then?
WHO Indeed! I am the one and only - and there’s nobody I'd rather be!
Exactly. You’re a fraud — so obviously bogus!
Y-ANNE Eh?
ZAME Don’t you see, Sal? You can't have an original idea nowadays. Now listen you - this is my patch, and I invented this operation, so hop off.
WHO I'm not hopping anywhere. I am the Doctor!
ZAME Yeah, yeah, I’m the Doctor, you're the Doctor, we're all the flipping Doctor. But this is my system, I’ve been working West Galaxy a long time, twenty-five years in this business.**
SALLY-ANNE So you'll do an about-turn if you fancy keeping your elbows intact.
I must really be missing something here. Who are these jokers?
WHO An immaculate deception, Mel. Allow me to ‘double’ check...
ZAME Here, get your hands off my chest!**
FX - BANTO slaps DOCTOR WHO's hands away. ¥
WHO There we are. A single heartbeat — if he’s a Time Lord then I am Marie of Romania.
SALLY-ANNE You'd better not try that on me.
I'm still lagging behind here.
WHO It all seems quite clear to me, Mel. They turn up ata planet, fake an alien invasion somehow — 3
I get it — they sweep in, foil the invasion and claim the credit.
WHO Playing off my not inconsiderable renown. Well, it’s got to stop!
SALLY-ANNE Too right it has.
FX — The door opens and POTIKOL and two GUARDS enter.
Doctor, Doctor, you must... what is going on? SALLY-ANNE (Simpering) Oh Councillor, you’ve simply got to help us. These people are intruders.
ZAME They're overexcited fans.
WHO Fans? Fans?
ZAME I get them all the time. ‘Doctor, what was it like on the planet Zenta? Doctor, what were you thinking when you defeated the Deadly Dustbins?’ et cetera, et cetera.
I see. Guards?” Take these two away.
FX - Door opens.
Sir?
Yes, take these two intruders away.
Sir.”
FX ~ The GUARD grabs DOCTOR WHO and MELANIE.
Hey! Get your hands off me!
WHO This is an outrage! I am the Doctor! I am the Doctor!** They are carted away and the door shuts. DOCTOR WHO rants ad lib as he is led away.
ZAME Please be gentle with them. It’s really very sad. SALLY-ANNE Did you sort out the problem at the Great Bank, Councillor?
If only I had. Doctor, Sally-Anne, we are in terrible danger.
SALLY-ANNE Not the Skelloids?
No, not the Skelloids. That object has destroyed our
dredger — and it's heading straight for us!*
A bit of an awkward silence.
(CONT'D) Doctor - er, did you hear what I said?
TAM (Laughs) Yes, yes, very good, Potikol, I get it. Very ‘unny.
Doctor, this is in deadly earnest. I wouldn't joke with you. SALLY-ANNE You mean - there really is a UFO heading here?
Yes. Thank goodness you're still here with us, Doctor.
Only you can save us now!
ZAME (Gulping, very uncertain) Quite. Oh...
12. INT. CELL - DAY
FX — GUARDS manhandle DOCTOR WHO and MEL into a cell and close the
bars, slide a bolt, i.e. lock them in. Dank, echoing atmos here.”
(Stern) You stay there until the Councillor decides what to do with you.”
This is a travesty of justice. You can’t treat us like this, we're the innocent parties. We have rights you know! Don’t we even get any food?
(Friendly) Yeah, course. There’s a machine in that corner. Next to the sofa.
Oh yes, sorry.
We've got business to attend to."
FX — The GUARDS exit up some steps. A door clangs shut.
Doctor, don’t look so downhearted. It’s not as if those two are actually doing any harm.
WHO It's not you whose reputation is being actively besmirched.
It’s quite a clever scam, really. I almost admire their pluck. How do they know who you and the Time Lords are anyway? You don't normally like to advertise your presence.

WHO This is the vulgar end of time, remember, Mel. Everything’s been said, done, bought and sold. Cheapened. (Sighs) I’ve become a legend. A laughable footnote in the history of the universe. People doubt I ever existed. Like Father Christmas.
Perhaps people here leave mince pies out for you. Oh come on, Doctor, that was worth a smile,
WHO I had hoped for a rather more fitting remembrance. Nowadays it seems any Tom, Dick or Cephalapod can go round claiming to be me, trading on my reputation.
Well let’s keep that reputation intact by getting out of this place.
WHO (Pulling himself together) Yes, you're right...’
FX — DOCTOR WHO moves to the door, rattles the bars and taps the lock.
WHO (CONT'D) Hmm, a simple trisonic lock. Should be easy... for a ‘legend’ like me.
He and MEL laugh. FX — A wave of feedback-type noise starts to fade up eradually.
What's that? An alarm?
WHO I don’t think so... It sounds like... like a multiphasing corpolectric soundwave! Very nasty! Who could be...?
It’s getting louder!
WHO Concentrate, Mel.? Try and blot it out! It’s our... only chance... to...
FX — The noise gets deafening.
13. EXT. GENERIOS STREET - DAY
The noise is louder here. The crowd are now crying out in terror. The sound of a huge engine getting closer. Wind whips around. SOKKERY has to shout to make himself heard over the hubbub.
SOKKERY™ (Now very drunk) Whassat? Whassat thing? It’s huger than the sky!
FX - He takes a swig from the bottle.
(CONT'D) Oh and we were having such a laugh... keep it down up there can't ya? Y'hear me...? I said...
His voice is lost in the din.
14. INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - DAY
FX — The noise is deafening here. They’re having to shout louder and
louder.
Doctor - that sound - it’s coming from the alien object! It’s right, above the city!”
ZAME (Panicked) Don’t look at me! I’ve no idea what it is. SALLY-ANNE It’s massive! Doctor, do something!
Help us, Doctor!
ZAME (Yelling) I can’t! I can’t!
15. INT. CELL — DAY.
MEL and DOCTOR WHO are still struggling against the din. Their voices slur as the soundwave invades their heads.
Aaargh... Doctor... I can’t... can’t bear it! What... is... it?
WHO (Struggling, his voice reaching a crescendo of pain and fear) ...a weapon... must fight... concentrate... aargh... it’s... destroying... our minds!!
CRASH IN CLOSING THEME. END OF PART ONE.

parts.searchable_dialogue:
DOCTOR: WHO At last, I control everything...” you are my pawns, to do with as I please... you have no choice but to bend to my will... yes, I own you... I am your creator — and I can be your destroyer...
MELANIE: Honestly, Doctor, stop being so melodramatic.
DOCTOR: WHO Mel, am I not permitted an occasional moment of melodrama?
MELANIE: Yes, but it’s only a game of Monopoly.
DOCTOR: WHO A game that I am winning... yes, there is no power but mine... I control Park Lane, Mayfair, the waterworks...
MELANIE: Doctor!
DOCTOR: WHO I want to imagine what it feels like to be a power crazed dictator. See into the enemy’s mind.
MELANIE: And?
DOCTOR: WHO Boring. And I hate hotels. Your roll.
DOCTOR: MELANIE A double six,
DOCTOR: WHO You're the iron, I’m the dog.
MELANIE: Sorry.
DOCTOR: WHO You're getting absent-minded. Most unlike you.
MELANIE: (Groans) Oh no.
DOCTOR: WHO Excellent. You must surrender to my will... two thousand, two hundred and sixty pounds rent, please.
MELANIE: All right.*
DOCTOR: WHO By the way, why did you reset the coordinates this morning?
MELANIE: I thought you did.
DOCTOR: WHO Yet more absent-mindedness...
MELANIE: I haven’t been near the controls. Guide’s honour.
DOCTOR: WHO (Amused) You were a Girl Guide?
DOCTOR: bleeps.
DOCTOR: Never mind that. These readings... the TARDIS is way off course...
DOCTOR: WHO Way, way off course... we've drifted millennia into the far future..
MELANIE: Who's done this? Who could control the TARDIS?
DOCTOR: WHO The same person who always does - or tries to. Me.
MELANIE: What do you mean?
DOCTOR: WHO I was experimenting with the navigation settings... and I must have accidentally switched on the wide-range distress transceiver. Knocked it with my elbow.’ The TARDIS responded automatically, like a dog fetching a bone. Yes, listen...
MELANIE: Where's it coming from?
MELANIE: 73
DOCTOR: WHO I don’t know. But we’re almost on top of it. (Wearily) We'd better materialise, I suppose... ?

in our Benny audios and was very keen to be in The One Doctor because of Chris Biggins. Again, Steve’s the kind of person who can turn his hand to anything at a moment’s notice. I think he had about three days’ warning that he was going to be doing this extra role.‘
